messages.title: VOTE GREEN FOR FAIRNESS AND A BETTER FUTURE
messages.content: The Green Party is a fresh voice in politics. With growing support and a full programme of policies it is a positive alternative to the tired politics of recent years.

messages.title: MAKE A DIFFERENCE
messages.content: VOTE GREEN ON MAY 6th A GREEN NEW DEAL AND A FAIRER TAX SYSTEM

keyPolicies.policyDescription: A charge on the top 1,000 bankers to help protect the public finances.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: PROTECT THE NHS – NO TO PRIVATISATION
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ensure NHS remains free at the point of delivery, oppose costly and unnecessary reconfigurations of NHS services. Provide free dental care with the choice of an NHS dentist for everyone.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: FAIR PENSIONS & CARE FOR OLDER PEOPLE
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Provide a decent basic pension for all of £170 a week and free and suitable support for older people living independently at home, in sheltered housing or in residential care. Recognise and support the valuable role played by carers.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A FAIR DEAL FOR YOUNG PEOPLE
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Value the vote for young people. Fully & immediately abolish university tuition fees. Fully link Jobseekers Allowance (JSA) for 16 to 18 year-olds to provide a right to work, training or education. Double Youth Services funding and provide a wide range of uncomfortable activities on top of a National Job Guarantee Scheme.

Create 4 million new jobs. Invest in a sustainable public transport system, build an electric train network, create energy-efficient homes within 2-3 years. Deliver car-sharing schemes and local car clubs.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: PUBLIC TRANSPORT – CHEAPER, BETTER AND MORE RELIABLE
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Bring the railways back into public ownership. Reduce train and bus fares by averaging out across the country, delivering an immediate 10% cut followed by year-on-year real-terms reductions.

mentions.tacticalSituation: York Central is NOT a Tory target seat.

issues.education: Fully & immediately abolish university tuition fees
issues.environment: Respond urgently to climate change creating 4 million new jobs
issues.health: Protect the NHS – No to Privatisation
issues.socialWelfare: A Fair Deal for Young People

leaflet.personalStatement: I'm standing for York Central to make a difference. I've lived in York for 20 years and I'm standing because I believe it's time we placed love back into York's wonderful image.

politicalExperience.role: Green Party candidate for York Central

endorsements.endorsement: "I believe residents want more from their MP than someone who will simply follow the party whip rather than the wishes of local people." - Caroline Lucas, Green Party Leader, pictured with Cllr Andy D'Agorne.

quotes.text: "Keeping York Special" is our slogan for good reason – we were the only party to oppose the massive York central expansion...

images.caption: Andy Chase calling for a fairer tax system at York's Robin Hood Tower.

leaflet.additionalNotes: York's Green councillors have: created York's first one-hour parking zones, tackled crime, graffiti and anti-social behaviour, fought loss of post offices and local bus services, and more as detailed in the leaflet.
